Question: Francis **** was an art dealer, and Sara was a former actress whose stage name was "Sara Sothern".
Hints: At her death, this person's jewelry collection was reportedly worth $150 million.
This person's persistence in seeking the role of Velvet Brown in MGM's National Velvet made her a star at the age of 12.
This person's first, Nibbles and Me (1946), discussed the child star's "adventures with her pet chipmunk".
